intro: Odontocarya arifolia, commonly known as the featherleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers bloom in spring and summer, producing a range of colors from white to pink. Odontocarya arifolia is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
